title: Wyre Spending: Year-by-Year Trends and What They Reveal
summary: Wyre Council's spending increased by £74.6M (107.9%) from 2017 to 2025, with a total spend of £683.0M across 51,092 transactions.
author: Wyre Council Transparency

title: Red Flags in Wyre's Spending: What DOGE Analysis Found
summary: The total spend analysed by AI DOGE is £683.0M across 51,092 transactions.
author: Wyre Council Transparency

title: Inside Wyre's Departments: Where Every Pound Goes
summary: The Finance department accounts for £510.4M of Wyre Council's spending, which is 74.7% of the total expenditure.
author: Wyre Council Transparency

title: Where Wyre's Money Really Goes: Top Supplier Analysis 2026
summary: The top 5 suppliers to Wyre Council account for £583.3M, which is 85.4% of the total spend.
author: Wyre Council Transparency

title: Wyre Borough Council: £678 Million and Lancashire's Narrowest Supplier Base
summary: 51,092 transactions to just 1,558 suppliers — the smallest supplier pool in Lancashire. Lancashire CC receives 48% of all Wyre's spend, driving an HHI of 2,796.8 that classifies as highly concentrated.
author: Wyre Council Transparency

title: Wyre's Concentration Crisis: When 48% Goes to One Place
summary: Wyre has the most concentrated spending profile in Lancashire with an HHI of 2,796.8. Lancashire County Council receives nearly half of all recorded expenditure, and just 1,558 suppliers handle £678 million across nine years.
author: Wyre Council Transparency
